text: Today would have been my younger brother Everett’s 56th birthday. I preached his funeral 2 weeks & 2 days ago. I didn’t take his last 2 calls from prison — rushing to a plane, & a meeting. Take the call. U never know when u won’t have the chance to speak again. Ever. #RIPEverett
author: MichaelEDyson

text: He is one of the All Time Greats. Period.
author: MichaelEDyson

text: Always great to hear from you.
author: MichaelEDyson

text: I’ll appear on @NewDay around 8:45am to discuss the cheating scandal in college admissions. Tune in if you can!
author: MichaelEDyson

text: I’ll be on @hardball to elaborate on my thoughts regarding the #postsecondaryscandals at 7:30pm ET @HardballChris
author: MichaelEDyson

text: Aiding parents to bribe elite college coaches to admit their kids — or paying folk to take the ACT/SAT tests for their children — is corrupt. Far worse: exploiting mostly black athletes who bring in millions of dollars w/ no pay while coaches make millions from shoe companies.
author: MichaelEDyson

text: My mistake! Happy much belated birthday.  You deserve to be celebrated daily ms @IAMANITABAKER

text: To all of my sisters, my sistahs... without your strength/grace/determination, I would be fearful for the future of our nation. But you continue to show up, show out & lead the way. Wishing you infinite love, peace & blessings on this #InternationalWomensDay & every other day.

text: I need all of y’all to vote for my man @The_ColeAnthony as High School Player of the Year! Yes, he’s that dope! Yes, he’s got those kinds of skills! Yes, he’s a superstar on his way to even greater acclaim in the near future! Hit the link and vote for him now! @CrystalMcCrary

text: My day was consumed w the celebration of my brother at his homegoing. But I can’t end this day w/o also honoring the memory of #TrayvonMartin. The pursuit for justice that #SybrinaFulton has embarked upon brings me hope in the midst of my own darkness. #wearetrayvonmartin

text: Thirty years of my brother’s life and as such, his connections to folk, were lost in the prison system. For friends and family who may have lost touch but want the opportunity to honor Everett, please join us as we celebrate his life.

text: But I am also infuriated with a system of criminal injustice that puts so many black and brown families in such hopeless circumstances. So, in my grief, I renew my commitment to fight for justice and criminal justice reform. And I do it in your name, Everett. I love you always.
author: MichaelEDyson

text: Words cannot express my sorrow as I share the news of my brother Everett’s passing. A few months ago, I shared this picture. I am devastated at the loss of my brother, but I was blessed to have the means to pay for our very frequent phone calls and for his ongoing legal defence.
author: MichaelEDyson

text: I’ve invited my Instagram followers to share their personal #blackhistory moments. Head to my page if you want to join in celebrating the beauty of our history. So many powerful legacies. #ourblackhistorywithMED https://instagram.com/michaelericdyson?utm_source=ig_profile_share&igshid=1fvwmj66mda44 …

text: Thoughtful response. Thank you. I disagree however. I didn’t invent the term nor the concept upon which the term rests.

text: My appearance this morning on @breakfastclubam talking about #Cancel Culture, @KamalaHarris and blackness, and racial politics in VA, including @RalphNortham! Michael Eric Dyson Explains His Beef With Cancel Culture, Kamala Harris ... https://youtu.be/-nJq_s4cj3s  via @YouTube
author: MichaelEDyson

text: Understood. But nothing I said suggested that. One tweet could never exhaust the meaning of my interpretation of race. Got to consult many of my 20 books for that. In fact consult my last two books. Thanks sir.
author: MichaelEDyson

text: Those two are not contradictory my friend: they are as old as dirt and yet as new as their most recent installment. He has amplified ancient hostilities. That’s an uncontroversial fact.
author: MichaelEDyson

text: I’m shocked you don’t understand that your father has unleashed the worst sort of racial hostility possible because of statements & actions that betray lethal ignorance & fatal bigotry. This may be a hoax — but your Daddy’s behavior is the greatest horror film since “Get Out.”
author: MichaelEDyson

text: Good morning sir!
